alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 8:55AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Benton, Delaware, Ottawa, eastern Mayes, northwestern Adair, southeastern Wagoner and Cherokee Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 855 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Commerce to near Bernice State Park to Rose to 2 miles southwest of Hulbert. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Tahlequah... Miami... Baxter Springs... Jay... Grove... Commerce... Locust Grove... Salina... Fairland... Afton... Quapaw... Langley... Colcord... Kansas... Okay... Hulbert... Bernice... Spavinaw... Wyandotte... Disney... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 294 and 324. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.

area.areaDesc: Adair; Cherokee; Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa; Wagoner
